brief_summary.textblock: The focus of the study is to evaluate the expanded version of PRISM 1.0 for a broad array of seniors with different needs and circumstances. The aims of the study are to: 1) obtain information on perceptions of the usefulness and usability of PRISM 2.0 and interface design issues; 2) examine the impact of access to PRISM 2.0 on social connectivity, engagement, social support, and perceived loneliness; 3) examine the impact of access to PRISM 2.0 on perceived isolation, well-being, and quality of life; 4) examine the impact of access PRISM 2.0 on computer attitudes, self-efficacy, technology proficiency and technology uptake; 5) gather data on usefulness of system features and if these vary by living condition; and 6) examine, in our statistical models, the influence of factors such as age, cognitive abilities, ethnicity, education on system use and outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Increase functional health and well-being as measured by modified SF-36
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 6 month follow-up and 9 month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Higher score means better functional health and well-being. Range (0-1400)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in loneliness as measured by Loneliness scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 6 month follow-up and 9 month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Higher score indicates a greater degree of loneliness. Range (0-80)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life as measured by World Health Organization
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 6 month follow-up and 9 month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Higher score indicates a better quality of life. Range (0-30)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in social connectedness as measured by Social Connectedness Scala, Social Isolation, and Perceived Social Isolation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 6 month follow-up and 9 month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Higher score indicates more social connectedness with others. Range (11-63)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in social support as measured by Medical Outcome Study from RAND Corporation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 6 month follow-up and 9 month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Higher score indicates more social support. Range (2 - 10)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 65+ years
- Able to read English at the 6th grade level
- Passing score of Social Isolation Screening
- Passing score of brief Technology Proficiency Screen
- Passing score of Telephone Interview for Cognitive Status (TICS)
- Passing score of Woodcock Johnson Reading Comprehension (Spanish equivalent)
- Passing score of Fuld Object Memory Evaluation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Blind or deaf
- Has terminal Illness or severe motor impairment
- Significant use of computer/Internet/email in the home or elsewhere
- Working for a paid more than 5 hours/week
- Participate as formal volunteer more than 5 hours/week
- Attend senior center or another formal organization for than 10 hours/week
